means: （与…）交往，联谊（ socialize的过去式和过去分词 ）

sentence.Network_en: You may have been socialized to do as you are told.
sentence.Network_cn: 也许你已经被同化了——让你做什么，你就做什么。

sentence.Network_en: It distressed her that she and Charles no longer socialized with old friends.
sentence.Network_cn: 她和查尔斯不再跟老朋友们来往，这让她非常苦恼。

sentence.Network_en: Children are socialized according to a given cultural pattern.
sentence.Network_cn: 儿童的社会化是依照既成的文化型态而进行的.

entry.tran: 进行社交活动;与人交往
entry.def: If you socialize, you meet other people socially, for example at parties.

example.ex: ...an open meeting, where members socialized and welcomed any new members...
example.tran: 会员相互交流，同时也欢迎新成员加入的开放型会议

example.ex: It distressed her that she and Charles no longer socialized with old friends.
example.tran: 她和查尔斯不再跟老朋友们来往，这让她非常苦恼。

entry.def: When people, especially children, are socialized, they are made to behave in a way which is acceptable in their culture or society.

example.ex: You may have been socialized to do as you are told...
example.tran: 也许你已经被同化了——让你做什么，你就做什么。

example.ex: From the time you are born you have to be socialised into being a good father.
example.tran: 从出生的那一刻起，你就得学习融入群体，最后变成一个好父亲。

entry.tran: 使…为社会所有;使社会主义化
entry.def: When something is socialized, it is made to operate on socialist principles.

example.ex: ...a socialist system in which the ownership of the means of production will be socialized.
example.tran: 生产资料所有权社会化的社会主义制度

example.ex: ...the debate over how a fully socialized economy might work.
example.tran: 关于全面的社会化经济如何运行的辩论
